text:
Chrono trigger and Cross are without a doubt, the only OSTs that can compete with Uematsu's work in FF.

I'd rank them:

FFVII > FFVI > FFIX > Chrono Cross> FFVIII > Chrono Trigger > FFX > FFIV > FFI > FFV

In terms of all time best ever. FFXIII-LR music being trash, of course.

@NanoEmpyrean 

Mitsuda's great and he composed most of Chrono Trigger's music but just thought I'd point out that "Underground Sewer" and this one("Silent Light") among a couple others such as "Tyran Castle" and "Sealed Door" were composed by Uematsu.  He helped Mitsuda with CT's OST during a period while Mitsuda was being hospitalized.

text: I agree, the Snes version is so much better, because it: doesn't have load times, the songs aren't downgraded, has a much better intro and doesn't have pointless cut scenes. In fact, I was just playing snes chrono trigger today and I got 2 endings.
